title: Coronavirus live updates: More than 182,000 people have been infected and over 7,000 have died. The US has reported 86 deaths. Here's everything we know.
text:
The coronavirus that originated in Wuhan, China, in December has killed more than 7,000 people and infected more than 182,000. It has spread to more than 145 countries.

The World Health Organization declared it a pandemic last week.

Nearly 4,000 deaths have been reported outside of mainland China, including 91 in the US.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

The novel coronavirus has infected 182,405 people and killed another 7,154 around the world as of Monday.

The World Health Organization declared it a pandemic last week.

China has seen a drop-off in its rate of new cases, but the virus has gained momentum in other parts of the globe. More than 79,000 people known to be infected have since recovered.

The new coronavirus — which causes a disease known as COVID-19 — had affected every province and region in China as well at least 145 other countries. Over 3,200 people have died outside mainland China.

A number of countries have declared nationwide lockdowns in a bid to stem the spread of the virus. President Donald Trump has suspended all travel between the US and Europe.

The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommended on Sunday that all gatherings of 50 people and more be postponed until May. Trump recommended against groups of more than 10.

Major professional sports leagues, including the NBA and MLB, have suspended play.

The US has reported cases in nearly every state and confirmed 91 coronavirus deaths: 48 in Washington state, 11 in California, 10 in New York, five in Florida, three in Louisiana and New Jersey, two in Virginia, and one each in Colorado, Georgia, Indiana, Kansas, Kentucky, Nevada, Oregon, South Carolina, and South Dakota.

Here's everything we know.
meta_description: The World Health Organization has declared the novel coronavirus a pandemic. It has spread to more than 145 countries.
